This game is FANTASTIC! Weird that I don't recommend it then, huh? The problem with Dead by Daylight is the absolute crap servers. When you're in the game it's spectacular, but it takes 30+ minutes of sitting in a lobby, then to watch people disconnect when you finally get all the people! It's ridiculous, and if the servers were fixed, I'd recommend it to everyone!
played it for a bit. it's pretty fun.

fun to play with a group of friends, but the game's community itself is really toxic, especially when you're against high ranked survivors as a killer (rank system is worth of fixing). and also the game contains lot of bugs and killer's hitbox sometimes makes me wanna gag. 

i still recommend the game, but be prepared to come across really salty and toxic people :----)

It's a fun concept and DBD does a great job of adding new content and characters. I don't recommend this game because there have been major balance issues for years that have never been prioritized. In DBD, you can play as a survivor by yourself or with friends. Playing with friends has a huge advantage because you get to communicate and coordinate. Killers have a higher chance of winning against solo survivors, but are at a huge disadvantage against a team of friends. The community has pleaded with DBD to add balancing patches that make playing as solo or with friends fair on all sides. They have done nothing in response, but add new cosmetics and characters which can be bought. I understand that DBD needs to make money to continue making new content, but the players also need a fair and balanced game. Until it is fixed, only play this game if you prefer survivor and can play with your other survivor friends.

I know that my play time is nothing compared to some of the players that have been playing this game for way longer than I have, but I still would like to share my opinion about the game after all this time.

Survivor main here, been playing since the end of 2017. Been through many events, ups and lows, and had plenty of fun while playing the game. But that's not what we are here for.


I hate the state of the game right now. It feels like a machine created to make as much as money as possible while leaving customers unsatisfied. Let me break it down to the main points:

-too many updates, not enough care: the devs keep pushing out new content without taking care of what's already there. While it's good for balancing the game, the amount of changes with each patch is ridiculous. I can leave the game on the side for one/two months and come back to what feels like to be a different game. As a casual player, this is really annoying. As soon as I learn how things work, DBD changes them and I have to relearn everything again, over and over. This updates also bring plenty of bugs to the game. The players discover these bugs during PTBs and then are get told to deal with them as soon as they get released in the game. You would think that a reasonable company would take care of the bugs first, before releasing them into the wild. But oh well. Gotta push out new content, doesn't matter if it works, right?

-maps disabled: on the topic of things not working; for the past months, at least 4 maps have simultaneously been disabled. And DBD keeps pushing out new content, breaking the game even more. The community has asked DBD on multiple occasions to slow down and take care of what they already have before adding new things into the game, but nothing;

-a community that's left behind: I don't know how many player surveys, how many times the community asked DBD NOT to do something and DBD went ahead and did it anyway, completely ignoring the consequences of their actions. Ya'll remember the Twins or February 2020, right? Dear DBD, what's the point of player surveys, if you're then going to ignore your community? DBD listens to its community only when they start screaming, just to completely ignore them as soon as things calm down a bit. As a player, this feels incredibly frustrating, as we are told that our voice counts only for it to be shut down and never listened to. I would love for you to prove me wrong, DBD. But we both know you won't, you have betrayed us over and over to the point that we can't trust you anymore. Especially if you're a veteran in this game, you feel extremely left behind.

-battle pass/shop: the shop is (in my opinion) overpriced. Though DBD can put whatever price they want to their own cosmetics, so I can't really say anything about it. On the other hand, DBD also possesses the worst battle pass to ever exist. I've had personal experience with battle passes from the games Rocket League, Apex Legends and DBD. In this game, you have to dedicate yourself 24/7 in order to be able to reach the end of the battle pass. The challenges force the players into taking roles they are not willing to play for a prolonged period of time just to unlock that one archive and get that extra boost. This doesn't make me want to play the game even more, it makes me hate the game even more. Overall, it feels incredibly unrewarding.


This are just some of the things that are not working in this game right now. This is without counting the bugs that have been present in the game since its release and haven't been taken care of yet (and they probably never will); the broken mechanics that punish the players instead of the developers (remember the Legion-mending thing?); the players that lost ALL of their data due to a mistake caused by DBD and then got told to deal with their loss; the events got boring, the rewards aren't worth it, I don't feel motivated to play the game during an event anymore; the list can go on.

As a player who spent so much time playing this game, learning the mechanics, creating long lasting friendships, teaching others how to play and most importantly, as a player who developed such a passion for Dead By Daylight... this hurts. Betrayed doesn't even get close to how I feel right now. I had a passion for this game, and DBD killed it. Every single thing the developers have done recently has only been filling me with frustration and disappointment. And I know that I'm not the only one feeling this way.

The hilarious part is that I know that I'm still going to play this game, eventually. I know I will. But it won't feel the same anymore, at this point. I really wish DBD would slow down and finally take care of what they already have before moving forward. But I also know that it's not going to happen.

I know that DBD feels like they did a really good job so far. But to me, they really didn't.

Thanks for reading, and have a good one, wherever you are.

~Hex: Fluffy Dragon

The game can be fun, but the majority of the time you have to play with friends for it to be fun due to all the toxic people in this game or the fact that the devs don't really give a shit about paying for better servers. They just give you crappy ones to where it makes the game really unfair at time due to the fact that you will die due to lag. Every patch they fix one thing then 6 more bugs come out when they do. Its a great game but still needs a lot of work still and if they gave a shit, they would of fixed the issues of the game a long time ago.

Buenísimo tanto jugando solo con extraños o junto amigos (MUY recomendado para jugar con amigos)

Puntos buenos:
- Si sos fan del suspenso y la tensión, este juego es tu salsa
- La increíble variedad de asesinos y supervivientes, si te apasiona el cine de horror ochentoso te vas a comprar básicamente todos los DLC.
- Es bastante simple pero tiene mucho encanto, te metes a jugar una partida y tenes que hacer otra y es un ciclo vicioso hasta que vez la hora y son las 3 de la mañana.
- No necesita una gran PC para que corra en unos FPS decentes.

Puntos malos:
- EL TIEMPO DE ESPERA PARA ENTRAR A PARTIDAS
- Si te toca con gente que no colabora en la activacion de motores o curación, sos pollo.
- Hay asesinos MUY rotos, incluso es frustrante, si les toca contra Freddy, vayan preparando el tuje.

Ayant joué auparavant sur Xbox, j'ai eu le temps de faire le tour du jeu depuis bientôt 2 ans.
Je trouve le système de jeu intéressant. Il y a un background à chaque personnages (tueurs et survivants) et je trouve ça plutôt cool. Le jeu est régulièrement mis à jour et les quêtes secondaires (archives) permettent de moins se lasser du jeu. Il y a de nouveaux skins  régulièrement et il n'y a pas forcément besoin de payer pour les débloquer ou débloquer de nouveaux personnages. 
Un des points faibles de ce jeu est, pour moi, la communauté parfois toxique. 
Je trouve dommage aussi de retrouver à chaque partie les mêmes compétences utilisées (tueurs comme survivants). Les compétences sont mal équilibrées et cela pose problème dans ce jeu. 
Enfin, il y a toujours un problème de facecamp (qui dégoute du jeu les survivants) ainsi qu'un problème de rush de générateurs (qui dégoute du jeu les tueurs) mais cela ne vient pas du jeu mais des personnes qui y jouent.
